Narrative: ON JANUARY 15TH, AT 12:30 PM, THE GW 2233 WAS ATTEMPTING TO ASCEND GOVE HILL WITH EIGHT LOADED COVERED HOPPERS ENROUTE TO GREELEY, CO DUE RO THE ACCUMULATION OF SNOW ANS ICE ON THE TRACKS, THE ENGINEER WAS HAVING TROUBLE MAKING THE MOVE. LOCOMOTIVE 4327 WAS AT OFFICERS JUNCTION.  I INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO ASSIST IN SHOVING THE TRAIN OVER THE HILL.  I WAS STANDING AT COUNTY ROAD 13 AWAITING THERETURN MOVEMENT OF 4327.  I COULD SEE THAT AS THE 2233 CROSSED HIGHWAY 34, IT DERAILED.  RADIO COMMUNICATION WAS GIVEN TO THE ENGINEER ON THE 4327 TO STOP THE SHOVING MOVEMENT.  THE 2233 MOVED ON ABOUT TWO CAR LENGTHS FROM THE POINT OF THE DERAILMENT AND THEN FELL OVER ON THE ENGINEER'S SIDE WHEN ITREACHED A SMALL BRIDGE CROSSING A LARGE IRRIGATION DITCH.  UPON REACHING THE GRADE CROSSING TWO BNSF EMPLOYEES REPORTED THAT THEY WERE AT THE CROSSING WHEN THE DERAILMNET OCCURRED.  THEY STATED THATTHE TRAILING END OF THE LOCOMOTIVE CAME IN CONTACT WITH ONE OF THE CEMENT PLANKS, PULLING IT UP FROMTHE ROADBED AND DERAILING THE LOCOMOTIVE. WHEN THE LOCOMOTIVE FELL OVER, CAR NUMBER SRV 5127 CONTINUED TO MOVE A HEAD.  IT MADE CONTACT WITH THE LOCOMOTIVE CAUSING EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO THE AL CORNER OF THE CAR.  NUMBER THREE AND FOUR WHEELS DERAILED. THE ENGINEER REPORTED THAT HE HAD HIT HIS KNEE ONTHE CONTROL STAND.  HE DID NOT FEEL THAT HE NEEDED MEDICAL ATTENTION . THE CONDUCTOR FELL TO THE ENGINEER'S SIDE OF THE CAB WHEN IT WENT OVER.  HE REPORTED NO INJURIES AT THE TIME. THE NEXT MORNING H
